title: Jones wants England to play with Liverpool 'ferocity'
description: Head coach Eddie Jones calls on England to perform with a "ferocity" akin to that of Premier League leaders Liverpool in their Six Nations opener against France on Sunday.

title: Six Nations: Scotland's Stuart Hogg drops ball on try line against Ireland
description: Scotland captain Stuart Hogg drops the ball on the try line in their opening game of the Six Nations against Ireland in Dublin.

title: Six Nations: Wales' Josh Adams scores try against Italy after 'beautiful' Dan Biggar pass
description: Wales winger Josh Adams scores his second try of the game after a "beautiful" through-the-legs pass by fly-half Dan Biggar against Italy.

title: Coronavirus: UK patient is University of York student
description: The university says the risk of the infection being passed on to other people on campus is "low".

title: Coronavirus: US and Australia close borders to Chinese arrivals
description: The US and Australia are among the countries that have implemented rare travel restrictions.

title: From 1973 to now: Archive video shows seven key moments of British-EU history
description: Votes, slogans and some recognisable faces in very old footage - these are a few of the key moments of British relations with the EU.

title: Australian Open: Sofia Kenin beats Garbine Muguruza to win title
description: American Sofia Kenin wins a first Grand Slam title by beating Spain's Garbine Muguruza in three sets in the Australian Open final.

title: Brexit: UK leaves the European Union
description: Celebrations and sorrow as the UK begins a new era outside the 27 nation European community.

title: Troubles victims' pension: Julian Smith praises campaigners
description: Julian Smith says people injured during the Troubles "fought hard for too long" for compensation.

title: Greyfriars Kirk: The 400-year-old church which inspired legends
description: Greyfriars Kirk is best known for the tale of loyal dog Bobby - but its history contains other notable chapters.

title: New faces, old rivalries - all you need to know about Six Nations
description: The Six Nations is back - with four new head coaches and a raft of uncapped potential. Here's a rundown of the key men and curveballs that lie in store for each team.

title: Mary Higgins Clark: Bestselling author dies aged 92
description: She wrote novels such as A Stranger is Watching and sold over 100 million books in the US alone.

title: James leads tributes at Lakers' first game since Bryant death
description: LeBron James leads tributes to Kobe Bryant at the LA Lakers' first game since he died in a helicopter crash.

title: Tamara Ecclestone burglary: Man and woman charged
description: Jewellery valued at tens of millions of pounds was stolen from Tamara Ecclestone's London home.

title: Can laughing at Brexit bring Leavers and Remainers together?
description: As the UK prepares to leave the EU, we ask remain and leave comedians - can we laugh at Brexit yet?

title: Newspaper headlines: What a difference 47 years makes
description: As the papers mark Britain leaving the EU we look at how Fleet Street covered the UK joining in 1973.

title: Kobe Bryant helicopter firm was not allowed to fly in fog
description: Island Express Helicopters was restricted to flying in clear conditions, officials say.

title: Coronavirus: How Facebook, TikTok and other apps tackle fake claims
description: Platforms are increasing efforts to block false information as the outbreak spreads and fear grows.

title: We've Brexited
description: The latest episode of Brexitcast marks the moment the UK formally left the EU.

title: Lowest transfer deadline day spend since 2010
description: West Ham's late capture of Hull forward Jarrod Bowen for an initial £18m is the only big-money move of the lowest-spending deadline day since 2010.

title: 'Obscene' 18-month delay for DWP complaints
description: The government department responsible for child maintenance faces criticism for long delays.

title: A last-gasp scramble & 'beating Mourinho' - how Man Utd landed lifelong fan Ighalo
description: How lifelong supporter Odion Ighalo became the answer to Manchester United's striker woes in a deadline day twist.

title: Huntington's disease: I'm taking a test that will reveal my future
description: Danielle's mum has Huntington's disease – now she’s finding out if she will also get it.

title: Black and in the police: 'I've been called a traitor'
description: Here's how black police officers are dealing with the stigma, like Love Island's Mike Boateng.

title: What does healing the Brexit divide mean?
description: The moment of Brexit is a time for healing, says the PM. But what does that mean?

title: Lina Ben Mhenni: The woman who blogged Tunisia's revolution
description: "Freedom, better education and health: that's all we wanted," one of Lina Ben Mhenni's friends says.

title: Kashmir avalanche: 'My baby's toy torch saved me from death'
description: Shakila was buried for hours under deep snow in Kashmir, hoping her daughter was alive.

title: Week in Pictures: 25-31 January
description: A selection of striking news photographs from around the world this week.

title: Trump impeachment: Failed witnesses vote paves way for acquittal
description: Bid to call witnesses in the Trump impeachment trial fails, setting up a likely acquittal next week.

title: Amazon rainforest: The 90-year-old trying to stop destruction
description: Newsnight was given rare access to a once-in-a-generation meeting of indigenous groups trying to save the Amazon.

title: Veganuary, Red January and Dry January: How have people got on?
description: BBC News speaks to people who gave up meat, ditched alcohol and took up exercise for January.

title: Brexit blind date: Nigel Farage and Rachel Johnson
description: The Brexit Party founder and a recovering Remainer talk Brexit over dinner.

title: Could you handle the most remote campsite on earth?
description: Take a look inside an Antarctic campsite and find out how they survive.

title: Australia fires: How a unique slug species survived
description: The bright pink species is only found in a small habitat in Australia, experts say.

title: Bafta masks: The foundry that makes bronze trophies
description: An average of 300 Baftas are made every year at a family-run foundry in Middlesex.
